meanings.definition: Relating to or caused by amoebas.
meanings.sent1: The scientist studied the effects of the amoebic infection on the cells.
meanings.sent2: The pond water was tested positive for an amoebic parasite.
meanings.sent3: The pet amoeba threw an amoebic party in the aquarium.
meanings.sent4: Her thoughts moved in an unpredictable, ever-changing, amoebic manner.
meanings.sent5: The slow, creeping, amoebic growth of the mold covered the entire wall.

meanings.definition: Resembling an amoeba in shape or movement.
meanings.sent1: The artist created an amoebic sculpture that seemed to flow and change.
meanings.sent2: The dance performance was characterized by an amoebic choreography.
meanings.sent3: The children giggled as they watched the playful, bouncing, amoebic blob.
meanings.sent4: The city's layout was an amoebic sprawl of interconnected streets and alleys.
meanings.sent5: The clouds in the sky formed an ever-shifting, amoebic pattern.
